question: A band-pass filter can be created by cascading a high-pass filter and a low-pass filter.
The bandwidth of a band-pass filter is the sum of the two cutoff frequencies.
A Sallen-Key filter is a second-order filter.
Filters with Bessel characteristics are used for filtering pulse waveforms.
The bandwidth of a practical high-pass filter is infinite.
In filters, a single RC network is called a pole.
A band-pass filter passes all frequencies within a band between a lower and an upper cutoff frequency.
An active filter uses capacitors and inductors in the feedback network.
A second-order filter has a roll-off of –20 dB/decade.
Butterworth filters have the characteristic of a very flat response in the passband and a roll-off of –20 dB/decade.
